page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: This farming area of Wiltshire is dominated by the eastern side of the market town of{Chippenham}(population just over 20,000).The area includes the oldest part of the town around the High Street and the Causeway just east of where the main A4 London to Bath road crosses the{River Avon. The town has a railway station on the London to Bristol line.Here is the large factory of Westinghouse Brake and Signal Company. There are several new housing developments on the outskirts of the town,but most of the area is given over to medium sized{dairy farms. The town has a large cattle market. There is little woodland and the land is generally flat at about 150 feet above sea level.
